image.altText: close up of sanjeev gupta in glasses

props.synopsis: Sanjeev Gupta is gone from the Whyalla steelworks but his troubles are far from over, with a former high-level international executive who oversaw the South Australian operation now suing for US $30 million in unpaid wages and bonuses.

title.children: Sanjeev Gupta accused of deliberately losing phones in unpaid wages court claim

image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: A woman is seriously injured in an alleged assault in Adelaide's southern suburbs overnight.

title.children: Teen arrested after woman allegedly assaulted near Adelaide library

image.altText: A guitarists' face is hidden behind a mess of hair as he headbangs.

props.synopsis: Heavy metal band KNAW dream of playing festivals one day. The problem is they are the only band of their kind around for hundreds of kilometres.

title.children: Heavy metal band embarks on 16-hour round trip for 40-minute gig

image.altText: Smiling man with dog and takeaway coffee

props.synopsis: Despite assistance dog Max wearing a vest and Garth Murray carrying his accreditation, they still faced illegal discrimination on a round-Australia charity walk, with one publican even calling the police on them.

title.children: Country pub calls cops on army vet and his assistance dog

image.altText: Columns of building with branches

props.synopsis: A new push to change South Australia's abortion laws to limit terminations after 23 weeks has been voted down in state parliament's Upper House.

title.children: Abortion legislation voted down in South Australian Parliament

image.altText: SA Police generic

props.synopsis: Police said a man was struck by a car on Hillier Road, Hillier, just before 8pm on Tuesday before he was rushed to the hospital where he later died.

title.children: Woman charged over fatal alleged hit-run crash in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A person in shadow walks through a caged internal courtyard covered in more shadows.

props.synopsis: Children and young people at Adelaide's only youth detention centre are being held to the floor in a restraint technique that "may constitute a breach of human rights and clinical best practice", according to a report tabled in parliament.

title.children: Report reveals SA youth detainees 'routinely' physically restrained

image.altText: A woman in a dark blazer sits in a room in front of a bannister and the window blinds are down

props.synopsis: Andrea Foster and her son Peter Spiniello continue to feel let down by a system they believe caused the death of their daughter, and sister, who was killed seven years ago by a mentally unwell man.

title.children: Family of woman killed by mentally unwell man says her death was 'preventable'

image.altText: A large purple and green aurora reflected across a wide open lake.

props.synopsis: One of nature's most dazzling shows was on display last night. Take a look at some of the photos taken across southern Australia.

title.children: Aurora australis lights up the sky over southern Australia

image.altText: People standing in a group wearing T-shirts that say "drink more, die younger".

props.synopsis: The Coonawarra Vignerons, in South Australia's South East, has deleted a post which attracted controversy for celebrating binge drinking.

title.children: Wine body sorry for 'disappointing' T-shirts bearing 'irresponsible' messaging

image.altText: A blonde jockey smiles as she holds a gleaming trophy aloft at a race track.

props.synopsis: History-making jockey Jamie Melham has hit the headlines for the wrong reasons, with the Melbourne Cup winner banned for 30 race meetings for careless riding that resulted in a race fall for Blake Shinn.

title.children: Cup winner Melham banned over incident that saw jockey break his leg

image.altText: man in car with hand out a window with gold rings on and woman in pink and blue shirt sits in passenger seat

props.synopsis: For the past 25 years the "king of weeds", Mark Facer, has been chasing and eradicating weeds. Now he has been called in to help graziers in far west NSW with the worst mesquite infestation he has seen.

title.children: 'Pablo Escobar of weeds' called in to tackle tree infestation in the millions

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: A Senate inquiry into South Australia's toxic algal bloom has been tabled highlighting "limitations" in how the government has handled the crisis.

title.children: Government preparedness for SA's algal bloom criticised in Senate report

image.altText: Donald Trump places a hand on his chest.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein is pushed back into the spotlight after a congressional committee unearths years-old emails in which the convicted sex trafficker refers to Mr Trump as "the dog that hasn't barked".

title.children: What's in the Epstein emails that say Trump 'spent hours at my house' with trafficking victim?

image.altText: A golden egg in a nest symbolising superannuation.

props.synopsis: Corporate watchdog ASIC is suing several players involved in the collapses of Shield and/or First Guardian, which led to Australians losing more than $1 billion of their retirement savings.

title.children: Players in First Guardian, Shield sued after Australians lose more than $1b

image.altText: A Menulog food delivery bag with pies in plastic.

props.synopsis: The food delivery company is set to shut down on November 26. Here's what we know about the closure.

title.children: Menulog is closing down in Australia. Here's what we know

image.altText: A woman in exercise guy at the nadir of a pull-up on a bar in a gym.

props.synopsis: Jade Henderson says she has been the victim of online abuse since breaking the Guinness World Record for the most pull-ups in an hour.

title.children: Gold Coast police officer's pull-up world record marred by online abuse

image.altText: Houses being constructed on estate.

props.synopsis: The Help to Buy scheme will open to applicants soon. However, new research finds almost half a million households could be eligible for just 10,000 places in the co-ownership scheme.

title.children: Half a million households may qualify for federal co-purchasing scheme

image.altText: A figure looks out at Inpex

props.synopsis: In the wake of a federal government investigation, a worker at major oil and gas company Inpex has spoken out, raising fears of exposure to dangerous air pollutants and claims of a toxic workplace where staff concerns are brushed aside.

title.children: Inpex gas plant worker speaks out over fears he's breathing in toxic chemicals

image.altText: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu standing with their faces very close to each other behind a podium

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has taken the extraordinary step of writing to Israel's President Isaac Herzog calling on him to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu of long-standing corruption charges.

title.children: Trump writes formal letter to ask for a pardon for Netanyahu

image.altText: an underwater shot of a white whale

props.synopsis: The albino humpback calf known as Siale was spotted heading north up the NSW east coast, at a time when most whales are searching for food in the Antarctic Ocean.

title.children: 'We really need her to turn around': Health fears for rare white whale

image.altText: man in navy blue suit raises his hand as he speaks in ukrainian parliament

props.synopsis: After his suspension from the post of justice minister, German Galushchenko said in a Facebook post that he would defend himself in court.

title.children: Zelenskyy allies face dismissal over widening Ukraine corruption scandal

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: The local share market takes another leg lower as labour force figures pour cold water on rate cut expectations. The corporate watchdog reveals its 2026 enforcement priorities, vowing to protect consumers from financial harm. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX tumbles as stronger jobs figures quash rate cut prospects

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Headline jobs figures positive but still concerns: Indeed economist
US House votes to reopen federal government
ASX extends falls as jobs figures dampen rate cut prospects

image.altText: An image of seven very bright white-blue stars among a cluster of less bright stars in a black sky.

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered the famous Seven Sisters or Pleiades star cluster, which is featured in many Aboriginal songlines, is surrounded by a huge, hidden stellar family.

title.children: Seven Sisters star cluster has thousands of 'siblings' across the sky

image.altText: ron robertson swann in front of Vault

props.synopsis: The artist whose sculpture headlines a regional Victorian tourism campaign says it's a "beat up to get publicity".

title.children: 'Vault' sculptor denies backing council's 'silly' PR stunt

image.altText: A young smiling man

props.synopsis: Cody Schaeffer is accused of assaulting five teenagers after he was hit with a fresh charge during his first court appearance.

title.children: Radio host hit with extra assault charge during court appearance

image.altText: A handcuffed woman in a tan coat escorted by two plain clothes detectives

props.synopsis: The 53-year-old told clients a "billionaire" was in their future, allegedly persuading them to take out financial loans before keeping a share for herself.

title.children: Handbags, $10k gold bar seized after 'fortune teller' arrested for fraud

image.altText: Shadows of four men on pavement

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan has vowed to harshly punish adults who recruit young Victorians into a life of crime.

title.children: Jacinta Allan takes aim at 'evil adult puppet-masters' in new laws

image.altText: woman with pram getting off train

props.synopsis: There is a problem with regional Victoria's top-of-the-line, six-carriage trains — they do not fit at more than a third of the state's train stations.

title.children: What do you do when your train is too long for the platform?

image.altText: The symbol for meta is sitting on top of a computer keyboard.

props.synopsis: The Telecommunications Industry Ombudsman wants to help Australians falsely locked out of social media accounts, but can't. Here's why.

title.children: Watchdog seeks powers to help those 'locked out of digital lives'

image.altText: woman in black blazer stands facing the camera

props.synopsis: The executive had a suspected stroke, went temporarily blind and was hospitalised five times after regularly clocking more than 100 hours a week on the job, according to documents filed with the Federal Court.

title.children: Woolworths executive worked more than 100 hours a week, lawsuit claims

image.altText: two girls getting into the back of a police car, two police members stand behind them.

props.synopsis: With young people in Kununurra making news for the wrong reasons over the last month, a police patrol shows the stark reality for children on the streets.

title.children: Stark reality of Kununurra's social issues laid bare

image.altText: F1 driver looking downcast, speaking to media, wearing a cap

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri will have to show "character" after his recent F1 disappointments says his manager, former Australian ace Mark Webber.

title.children: Piastri set for test of 'character' as F1 season unravels

image.altText: Lavish Lazuli with clown face paint and red top holding yellow book against rainbow background

props.synopsis: A drag performer reading a picture book usually would not be considered controversial, but within one Western Sydney local government area, an LGBTQIA+ group is defying a council ban.

title.children: The community effort to overturn a Sydney council's drag story time ban
